Paper: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1712.03931.pdf
Website: https://minosworld.github.io/

Minos allows for flexible user interface to modify the environment and the material of the furniture, and specification of sensory suite. 

Interesting that the agent is provided  with a vector pointing towards the goal, in the “point goal task”. We could apply this .

It’s good that it does instance segmentation too — don’t know if the semantic fusion guys predicted labels for objects of the same class, but instance labeling (rather than just semantic) would definitely be preferable when developing embeddings for what’s in the image and how similar it is to previous scenes.

Sensory inputs:
  1. rgb/grayscale
  2. depth
  3. Normals (computed from 3d mesh)
  4. Contact forces (know when it’s bumping into things)
  5. Semantic segmentation/instance segmentation
  6. Agent measurements

Things that can be varied (For data augmentation purposes):
  1. material variations. This can only be done in a ‘semantically consistent way’. Aids with generalization
  2. Object clutter variation: Sets of object categories can be removed from scene.

You can also change the navigation goal and task specification (specifying reward signals.)



Code: https://github.com/minosworld/minos
